summary: This is an email chain between attorneys discussing the filing of the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) in the Jane Does v USA case by Brad Edwards. It shows legal coordination regarding the sealing and potential unsealing of the agreement.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Appears as a recipient and sender in the email chain discussing the filing of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

persons.name: JLeflcovi
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in the email chain, likely a colleague or co-counsel involved in the case.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Filed the Non-Prosecution Agreement with the Court in the Jane Does v USA case under seal and requested its unsealing.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Addressed in the email along with Roy Black regarding the filing of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

connections.description: Communicating via email regarding legal developments in the Jane Does v USA case.
Addressed together in an email about the filing of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.
Brad Edwards filed legal documents that are being communicated to Roy Black and colleagues.

events.title: Filing of Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Brad Edwards filed the Non-Prosecution Agreement with the Court in the Jane Does v USA case under seal and requested its unsealing.

keyFacts: Brad Edwards filed the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) in the Jane Does v USA case on December 5, 2008.
The NPA was initially filed under seal, and a request was made to the Court to unseal it.
The email chain shows legal coordination among attorneys (Roy Black, JLeflcovi, Jay) regarding this development.
The document references the case 'Jane Does v USA', indicating civil litigation against the United States government related to the Epstein matter.
